meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>drift</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to drift</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to waft</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: You're going <vocabulary>to drift</vocabulary> away. Drifting drifting drifting. Then, you turn into a yo-yo and yell "<reading>ta-da yo</reading>-yo (ただよ)! Not sure why drifting turns you into a yo-yo, but imagine it and don't question it.
